page.title: 17HOUSING
page.content: Going along Kessock Road you pass the old Coastguard Station and the Watch House.Then comes the council housing estate people call"The Ferry".It was a deprived area with many problems.Â£7m were spent to improve it.Mrs.Stewart likes her house now.Her garden is smaller and easy to keep.She has central heating and two toilets.Her street is Carnac Crescent now, and all the neighbours have bright curtains on their new windows.It is quieter.People like the Community Centre and soon they will run it.The Community policeman fixes football matches and outings.The children go to Merkinch School and Nursery,all modernised. There will be a Family Advice Centre and a Training Centre for the mentally handicapped people of Inverness.It is sad so many are unemployed,but there is not so much vandalism.It's better.
